Näituse 20-318
50409 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Overview of U.S. Corporate and Business Law pertaining to types of business organizational structures in the U.S. and laws of contracts in the U.S. followed by demonstration of the ability to distinguish between legal aspects of business organizational structures and preparation of basic contract draft in accordance with U.S. contract law.

objectives.en:
The primary objectives of this course are:
1.	Understand the basic types of business organizational structures in the U.S. 
2.	Understand the advantages and disadvantages of each type of business organization in the U.S. and the potential liability issues of each 
3.	Understand the elements of various types of contracts in the U. S. and relevant legal requirements
4.	Understand the agency relationships and the elements of contracts common in the corporate/employment setting in the U.S.

learning_outcomes.en:
By the end of the course a student will have:
1.	The ability to distinguish between types of business organizational structures in the U.S. and identify advantages and disadvantages from a legal perspective
2.	Ability to draft a short contract draft containing requisite contractual elements and demonstrating basic knowledge of U.S. contract law.
